I think the biggest disappointment of the night was the seating and that the entrees don't come with maduros...hello - I've NEVER eaten at a Cuban restaurant that doesn't include maduros with the entree.  An extra $4 for a half a plantain - give me a break!

I think the true rating should be 1 1/2 but that's not an option.  The food was average so it deserves a 2 but everything else deserves a 1.

This is my favorite Cuban joint in Vegas. Food, service, inside atmosphere and location was cool. Price is reasonable and plenty of parking spaces. If you're ever in Vegas and craving for some authentic Cuban food or would like to try Cuban food for the first time, then this is a good place to go. However, it's about 20+ mins drive from the Strip area.

I really wanted to try this place. I live Cuban food, and I figured this would be my go to. Unfortunately, the food was not good. My husband isn't familiar with Cuban food, so he decided to order salmon. I ordered Havana chicken and tostones for the table. 

The salmon was terribly salty, the Havana chicken was so bland that I just took it home to make something else with it. It was moist though. The tostones we're friend so hard, we couldn't bite into them. It was like eating a rock. All in all, the meal cost $63, and was very disappointing. Then, we waited almost 20 minutes  for the bill. I will not returning. My suggestion is save your money and time.

50% off at lunch time.
Good bread with butter.
Food was ok.
Nice atmosphere though.

This place is one of our favorites. Very accommodating for any size group. They also do separate checks for large parties. But best of all their food is delicious. Definitely a place we will continue to frequent.
I have been here a couple of times and i love it my husband is cuban and im mexican so this restaurant fits our liking the servers are almost very attentive i love it !!

By the picures shown..the Camarones Al Ajillo looks good. Though I haven't tried this location yet..I think I might try them! Their other location sucks..I'm glad they finally got the message to state their Mexican food items "as such".  Its hard to find a good totally authentic Cuban meal in Vegas! They'll usually mix in Argentinean..Italian and Mexican without identifying this...Cuban food is very unique and it has Spanish and French origins. I hate when they try to mix other origins in, when Cuban by itself is just fine!  Will update once I try them!

Trying this place out with my Cuban friends. Heard this was the place to be for Cuban food so why not. They have exceptional food here! I got the picadillo and it was amazing. Service was a little slow that's why I gave them 3 stars. Should not take 20 minutes to get water to the table, but oh well. The food was exceptional so it makes up for it. I would recommend and come here again.
Do your taste buds a favor and come to this place it's fantastic very reasonable authentic Havana food and the even have a band and patio seating on the weekend. Even a dance floor

A friend suggested we meet here- glad she did!
This restaurant brings the food of my Friend's childhood- she's a crazy Cuban;)
Flavorful, traditional dishes and some with a Mexican twist! 
Crunchy plantains, savory sauces AND timely and pleasant service!  Crafted mojitos and the bartender ensures the cocktails were to our liking.  She even had us test tasting some of the other creations she makes behind the bar- bonus!  
Started with some slices of pressed, oh so warm and delicious Cuban bread. 
OH the croquetas and that creamy inside filling!  Havana Grill has me at the croquetas. 
Be sure and try the mini Cubano sandwiches as well- just save some room of that entree!
I had the salmon with taste awakening dipping marinades for me to choose from.      All were made from scratch and sleuthed my taste buds.  Salmon cooked perfectly and the side of black beans- oh my;). 
A lovely lady (who turned out to be the owner) was whipping up some caffeine all by hand and provided us with her delectable Cuban caffeine delights!  No winner between the two- both were tasty!
Yes, they have HH aka happy hour from 4pm-7pm; a nice spacious outdoor patio as well!
Definitely the best cuban restaurant in Vegas. I have been there multiple times and they are even better every time.

We've been going here for years.  Used to be good service, good food.  Today, only good food.  We stood at the hostess stand a few minutes, a server with a tray excused himself between us to deliver a tray, not once saying "Just a minute folks."  We waited, and finally asked the bartender "Should we just take any seat?"  He nodded, and so we did, grabbing our own menus from the hostess stand.  As soon as we sat down, a blaring narrator came over the PA system from a current fad class in drinking and painting.  The instructor boomed over the PA system, drowning out the restaurant's music playing overhead.  We ordered croquetas, papas rellenas, black bean soup, and arroz con pollo.   Delicious!  If only we could have had a conversation together over the din of the art instructor giving painting instructions to the 20 or so drinking/painting students.  Must've been some marketing gig to get people in on a Tuesday evening.  The service was terrible.  Delivered chicken soup rather than black bean.  Corrected.  Never once refreshed our water glasses or asked if we needed another delicious mojito.  This place is slipping in service.  Sorry to see this.  The food is still good, but the service sucks.
Food is great here .... keeps me coming back . Chicken is juicy flavorful n the arroz morro is delicious (I had to check the kitchen , thought they had my mom back there cooking the rice)

The ambiance is great. Friendly employees and the owner greets you on entering. They take your order quickly and the drinks are strong. Passion mojito Your welcome . The portions are nicely sized. The pressed steak w sauteed sweet onions perfectly done. The rice was sweet and the beans were delicious.

Came to see Caseroloops, the Venezuelan Grammy-nomiated band. The band itself was good, but I can see the Havana Grill has taken a dive lately. I remember when this place used to be packed every weekend with live bands and a 'happening' atmosphere, taste appetizers available until late, and fruity mojitos. This time around, the atmosphere was dead (except for the band playing), the mojitos were expensive ($9 ) and watered down, and I believe the kitchen had already closed. I am not quite sure what happened.

If I had to vote this place thumbs up or down, it would the latter. I can't imagine going there and having much fun, given the stale overall atmosphere. Now I have to find another latin music spot.
Food was ok, Vaca Frita tasted like salt and service was horrible!  Mojitos start at $8.50? Drink prices reminded me of the price gouging strip casinos. Service was so bad we skipped dessert....

Why only 3 stars, guys?  I thought this  place was like a trip to Miami without the jet lag. Brought a Cuban food virgin along- we love it. The Bistek de Palomilla and the Old Man's Clothes (beef)- can't remember the Spanish name. Roja de Viejo or something like that. Both very tasty. The Yuca Frita was great too. Didn't have drinks at lunch, can't comment on that.

I have become that person that does not experiment and am dead set on finding the best arroz con pollo in town. Havana Grill might not be as good as what I would eat at a childhood friend's house, but it was tasty. The rice was flavorful without being too salty or overly seasoned. The chicken was moist and fall off the bone tender. The plantains were cooked to perfection. The three pieces were soft, sweet, and not dried out. There have been many times where I go to a Cuban restaurant to be disappointed in finding that their plantains have the consistency of Styrofoam. The plates are large and can easily feed two people. I ordered this with a side of the steamed yucca. Yucca is a root vegetable that is mellow in flavor. It could have used some citrus to make it taste bolder. The onions on top adds a nice contrast in texture. So far, Havana Grill serves one of the better arroz con pollo I have had in a restaurant. My friend had ordered the chicken simmered in red wine with potatoes and olives. This was the better dish of the two. Served with black beans and rice, it is a great deal at $12.

My wife, along with some friends and I came here for a night out. The ambience was absolutely delightful. Live music, in addition to amazing service, great food, and very tasty drinks, made for the perfect evening. I highly recommend Havana Grill; the restaurant is a gem.

Last Friday after work I met up with 3 friends I haven't seen for a few months to catch up over drinks and appetizers.  First of all, the food was bland.  Secondly, and most important, the service was awful.  Water refills were hard to get.  But here is the real kicker, which I must preface with the fact that the restaurant had low to moderate occupancy.  After an hour and a half, a female staff member approached our table, placed her hands on her hips, shot us a don't mess with me look, and barked, "Do you want anything else??"  She might as well have said GTFO biznatches!  We left with the quickness and won't be returning.

Food is really good but the service is extremely slow. It took 15 minutes to get a server to order food and 20 minutes just for the appetizer to come to the table. The main course took 45 minutes to get to the table. The restaurant needs to improve their staff.

I had about 45 mins to kill before the movie and decided to stop in and have dinner. Well I should have known standing there at the front for about 1 minute without being acknowledged , was a sign of what was to come. I made my way over to the bar and got seated, still no acknowledgement by the waitress who was either ringing up an order or getting someone their bill. I had high hopes for this place, but the lack of service left me with a poor taste in my mouth.

My wife and I loved this restaurant. The food was delicious. And the Cuban atmosphere was completely authentic. Servers were wonderful and kind. Plus, most of our servers and employees that we encountered were actually Cuban which I really appreciated. Speed of service was also timed ideally.

I lived in Miami for two years and I've missed this sort of a restaurant since then (5 years ago). The Ropa Vieja tasted like it was made by a Cuban abuelita.

We plan to go there next week to check out the live music and I will update this review then.

Very yummy food and great ambiance with the live music. The acoustic guitar player was amazing and had a beautiful voice that was just the right volume so you can still chat without having to scream to be heard. It had been a few years since I had been here so I was a bit surprised that they have added a whole new Mexican section to the menu. I feel like that kind of defeats the purpose of going out for Cuban food just to order nachos so we stuck with the more traditional section of the menu. My friend and I ordered the lechon asada as well as the fricase de pollo to share. The lechon asada was this delicious savory pork dish but the fricase was pretty dry and didn't have much flavor in comparison. A little disappointed that they didn't have the traditional guava pastries for dessert, however, not a deal breaker and it would not deter me from coming back.

I've been coming here for at least 10 years but never wrote a review. Bottom line it's where I always take guests when they're in town because I know it's going to be great food, great service and great experience. I always get the lechon asada al despolote, I've even tried to recreate the dish myself at home (with zero success ) 
Bottom line, make sure you end up eating here to have some great Cuban food. You'll never regret coming to this restaurant.

My Cuban friend recommended this place, saying it was authentic. I can't vouch for authenticity, since I haven't had much Cuban, but my tastebuds were happy. 

We ordered Lechon Asado (roasted leg of pork marinated in citrus juices and sauteed with onions) and the Arroz con Pollo (Cuban chicken with rice). Both dishes were tasty. Next time, I will try Polla a la Plancha ("Boneless chicken breast pounded and marinated in tropical citrus juices and sautéed on the flat griddle with onions"). The plantains were deliciously perfect (good texture, not too greasy, sweet). Portions were generous.

Havana Grill is a good, solid place. Service, ambiance, food -- todo bueno*! 

*(Todo bueno except the bread they served, which could have been buttered more, but it's just bread, and it was ok. Of course, I could ask for more butter, and I'm sure they'd be happy to oblige. The servers were very friendly, professional, and accommodating.)

Family-friendly restaurant (noticed some families with small children) and it appears, from the website and the buzz here on Yelp, that they have dancing on Fridays and Saturdays. From the website, it also says: "Happy Hour, Tuesdays to Sundays, From 4pm to 7pm, At 50% OFF - All Drinks"

There should be a system to judge based on service too and not just food. The food would get a 4 star and the service would be a 0. The food was very tasty but it took awhile to even get and to order. We sat at the bar and there was one other couple there with us.

They were already paying to leave but it still took the bartender a while to get our drink orders. 
After that we waited a while longer to be able to put in our food order. We got our chips n salsa after about 8 minutes of waiting, which is fine but really, there was two tables on the main floor and the other server kept hiding somewhere in the back. People at the table had to come up to the bar to ask for their check. 

After we got our food a guy came in and the server was too busy talking to him to pay attention to anyone else. My husband just wanted another beer. My mojito has no alcohol in it. I would know, I'm a 110 pound light weight who usually can only handle one drink since I become bright red and semi drunk, the drink just tastes like sour juice and sugar, I didn't even get a light buzz or redness. My husband gave up on the beer and we decided to just Togo the rest of the food to go home and eat it. 

It was very unfortunate for the restaurant owner because the cook was very good but if their servers and bartenders are not performing, it drives customers away.

We love Havana Grill! We go here for lunch every time we're in Vegas (about once a month) and we always leave happy. We used to go to Florida Cafe (connected to Howard Johnson Inn on the north end of the strip) but it's a bit of a trek for us and parking is always difficult in our oversized truck. So when we discovered Havana Grill has the same owner we were thrilled. Everything we've tried from the menu has been delicious. And the mojitos are amazing. The back patio seating is really nice in the cool months.
Great Cuban sandwiches love it!!! Excellent service great atmosphere did take out on a rainy day but will be coming back to enjoy a great dinner evening with hubby.
Great food and great service! Havana Grill, your food doesn't hold a candle to my moms authentic Cuban cooking but it's the next best thing! Love the place!

Boy, I was very underwhelmed by Havana Grill.  First of all, I've been primed for a good Cuban sandwich for at least a year. I've seen them on Anthony Bourdain's shows and Andrew Zimmern's, and they look juicy and scrumptious. I guess those were the made-for-TV versions, because the one I got here wasn't much different from something I could have gotten from a deli.  

I've since looked up "Cuban sandwich" online and the Havana Grill's offering looks pretty much the same as the images I find on Google.  Damn you, travel shows, for raising my expectations!   Honestly, if someone had handed me one of these at work or something, the most I would have thought was, well, the bread is interesting. Not a bad sandwich, but nothing memorable. 

My friend had fries with her sandwich and they were basic fries.  I had the fried plantains and liked them: crisp, not too thick, and not oversalted.  

Two friends ordered the ropa vieja- one had chicken and the other tried pork. They were kind enough to give me a taste, and I must say, the sauce for these dishes was delicious! It came with beans and rice, and those beans were very tasty as well. 

I forgot to mention the appetizers: we tried papas rellenas and tostones.  The papas (sort of like fried balls of mashed potatoes with a small filling of meat) were interesting  but I thought the flavor was just kind of "meh"- again, not memorable. I was not fond of the tostones- the fried green plantains. In fact, none of us ate much of those.  For me, they just had very little flavor.  One thing we gobbled up, though, was the buttered bread!  Very good bread. 

As for beverages, one of us tried the mojito and gave it a big thumbs up.  Another tried the raspberry margarita and although she can put away a drink, she didn't finish this one.  (She was also surprised that it came with salt on the rim rather than sugar. I don't know about such things, since I'm not much of a drinker).

The restaurant had a spacious, open feel  because the tables aren't crowded together. The tropical-themed leaf ceiling fans were kind of nice, too.  Simple, non-fussy wood tables and chairs add a casual flair.   

OH - I have to add that service was V E R Y  S  L O W.  The servers (all good looking, - like GQ good looking)  took forever just to put the bread baskets on the table - even after we asked for it.  It took a long time to get our orders taken.  Upon check out, they mistakenly added a gratuity to the bill. Correcting the error took almost 20 minutes because of one or two other errors made during the correction of the first problem. Aggravating!

After 9pm the loud music began, thanks to two DJs spinning (well, spinning hard drives, at least) some hearty Latin dance music. By 10 pm the dance floor was dark and the party was in full swing, with folks young and old doing all sorts of couples dancing. I picked up a few new songs thanks to Soundhound, and enjoyed watching people through the laser-lights.  I also had fun watching my friend get her butt smacked by a 70 year old woman on the dance floor!  We decided we'd come back for the music, the bar, and dancing, but would be less likely to return for the food.

Nice upscale Cuban restaurant. My beautiful one and I were on the south side of town just hanging out on a Saturday afternoon and we decided to have a late lunch here. First,  wonderful authentic decor with easy listening music. Atmosphere and Ambience very laid-back. She ordered Tamal en casuela soup and I ordered Pan con Bistec with banana chips accompanied by lemon and garlic sauce. The presentation of the food was very impressive. Sampled a bit of her soup texture was very .good moist very tasty soup. My steak sandwich was awesome very moist onions sweet sauteed just right. Banana chips with fried lightly was a very good distinctive taste with the lemon and garlic sauce.  Service was very nice.

Idk why I went in thinking it was a high end Latin restaurant, I think it's a bit tacky to charge for nachos and salsa while you wait for your order. The costumer service was excellent, but the dj was way off he would go from Latin to hip hop super randomly. I ordered nacho macho (carne Asada nachos) it was all night, meh, oh yeah pricy btw

There are not many Cuban places to eat at in the Las Vegas Valley and my uncle would be disappointed if I didn't have ropa vieja every now and again. This place has friendly services and a great atmosphere. The food is the closest to home cooked Cuban food. I have come to eat with mi Tia and my favorite friends Ben & Julie. 
I have had a cuba libre and my ropa vieja very time. Go in ready to enjoy the cuban music. 

Note: This is one of the few in town and I do not have anything to compare it to in town.

I am usually here for happy hour with friends, so we're always at the bar (outdoor bar space is great when it's not too hot!) and always well taken care of.

Drinks: Fresh, flavorful, and flowing. Whether going more tradicional and ordering mojitos or sangria or whether you want somehing more cosmopolitan (dirty martinis are always a good choice!), these bartenders know what they are doing. Lots of flavor, lots of fuel, and lots of smiles.

Food: The fried plantains are crispy, have a nice fresh taste, and were perfectly salted. We've had a few types of dips and salsas with these, depending on the mood of the group or the proprietor (specials, etc.) and have yet to find one we didn't like.

The slow roasted pork was tasty if a bit on the chewy side. I don't know if they needed a better cut of meat or more time in the cooker. Either way, it was flavorful but the texture made it less than a "I'll fight you for the rest" kind of dish.

The tamal was tasy and the masa was good, but there is just not enough meat to make this any more than a masa dish... think polenta with a cuban flair. I wanted more filling and more of their delicious sauces. Fell flat. Totally something I can see them improving... and I hope they do.

Service is always great, either because our group tends to draw the servers in or because they are just that good. Either way, it works for us! The matriarch/owner is always sweet, keeping watch over his home away from home. Great energy from a great staff.

It's not phenomenal (it doesn't have to be), and I prefer the food over at Cuba Cafe. However, it's a solidly good, A-OK, happy hour joint that I look forward to visiting again.

Went to check out Happy Hour today.  Jany was the bartender and she was fantastic.  So friendly and helpful.  We know nothing about Cuban food and she helped us make great selections from the happy hour menu.  Husband loved Cuban sandwich, I loved the  croquettas and Papas fritas.  Great value and great food will definitely go back

While the food and drinks are good, the service is absolutely horrendous each and every time I've gone here. If you're going for a special occasion just don't because the service alone will ruin your night. The servers are very friendly, however, the kitchen staff is extremely slow. Entrees are brought out one by one so a person in your party gets their food 20 minutes before the next. Just get takeout.

I really love this restaurant! I will definitely be coming back soon! This was my first time. The weather was nice, so we sat in the patio. They did have the fans on which helped a lot. But, as it got darker and darker, it became more beautiful and cooler. On Friday and Saturday nights, they have dancing!

We ordered many different things. Most of which I really liked. The avocado stuffed with shrimp was delicious, it also had a very delicious sauce. I also loved the plantains. "Platanos Maduros." But, my favorite where the potato balls. "Papas rellenas!" Mashed potatoes stuffed with meat on the inside and fried. Also, the dessert was amazing. It does have a name that will make you blush. You'll know what I mean when you see it!

The service was excellent. There was a pretty woman with long hair helping us. She was very knowledgeable and she tried to help us make the better choices. She was also checking up on us frequently. The best boy was also a big help and very courteous.

I'm from Las Vegas and every time I am home I try soo hard to get to Havana Grill!  

I am absolutely OBSESSED with their black bean soup!  It's amazing.  I always order a bowl instead of a cup because it's a large portion, and it takes everything in me to save half to take home.  Something about the spices in this soup are too perfect.  I also always ask for extra onions on top. I love it, I love it, I love it!

For lunch, I will always get the Bistec sandwich (half size).  It's very tasty and very filling, especially after my soup.  The bread it comes on is buttered, garlicy, and toasted.  For my side, I usually get fries (I don't even like fries that much, but I do like them here at Havana Grill), and my Mom always gets the plantains.  Their plantains are on point!!  

I only wish they were open on Mondays, too!

I've been spoiled with great cuban food before.  This place was terrible.  The food was bland and inedible.  Even the mojitos were bad - they are made with a mix and they didn't even crush the mint leaves.  It's too bad because the restaurant is very nice looking and the service is great.

Being from Miami and being Cuban American, I am definitely somewhat of an authority on cuban food. With that said, this fell short of the real thing... WAA WAA.... 
I ordered a ton of food, to go for myself and some friends of mine. I have been raving about Cuban food and was excited to share my culture and was let down. The main dishes (the meat) was actually decent - we shared fried steak or Vaca Frita (right on with the flavor) and breaded chicken-Pollo empanisado. However ALL the side dishes tasted frozen or packaged. The congri or arroz moros were NOT home made and the platanos were definitely from frozen banaas. The tostones (salty, fried plantains) tasted chalky (frozen) and the mojo (sauce for the fried plantains) wasn't even close to authentic mojo. Mojo is literally the easiest thing to make, why not make it fresh! Maybe I am overly critical because I have grown up with Cuban food and have had TRULY authentic versions (out of my grandmothers kitchen) but, this was so SAD... 

Oh well, Miami is only a plane ride away.

By the way- It shouldn't take an hour to put food together, for a to-go order when you phoned in the order, thirty minutes prior.

Nice place, check, good mojitos, check, check, good service, triple check.  Aaaand they play live music after 11pm and have room to dance on Fridays.  Lechon Asado, mmm, yummy.  Fried yucca (manioc/casava) with mojo, even yummier.  Paella, very good.  Great time, great looking restaurant.  I'm a happy camper.

We brought a bunch of people to Havana Grill because it used to be my favorite restaurant, until now! No longer real Cuban food! I'm fairly certain they got bought out by Florida café. this is one place in town I knew I could go to get real authentic Cuban food, I am sad to say this is no longer the case! We are in a Cuban sandwich there were no pickles! Ordered the tamales had zero flavor, I so missed the sweetness of the Cuban tamale! The worst part of it all was when I ordered a Cafecito (traditional Cuban coffee) she asked me if I wanted expresó or regular coffee, and then if I wanted milk and sugar. I don't know what it was that she brought me but it was not a cafecito. There was zero language barrier! I am Cuban and by nature Spanish is my first language! So disappointed!

Took advantage of Groupon offer and was really hoping past experiences would not be repeated in regards to service.  Food as usual was just okay but service continues to be horrible.  Upon being seated, our waiter took care of patrons that came AFTER us...okay possibly an honest mistake.  But then our waiter NEVER checked back with us until the very end of our meal...inexcusable!!!

This place is amazing my hubby is Cuban but we rarely get Momma's cooking SO THIS WAS A TREAT !!!! The flavors are phenomenal !!! Everything was cooked super fresh Delicious delicious will definitely be coming here a lot !!!! Service also was outstanding

I just went to Havana Grill for the first time and sadly it will be my last. I did not personally get to order any of their food off of the menu, however I did get to try their free bread they give you before your meal is delivered and I have to say that was tasty. I also ordered their passion mojito and that was good albeit pricey. 

My bad experience was with the staff of the restaurant. We were in a semi-large group of people sitting on the patio, ordering lots of appetizers, food and alcohol. Apparentely there was an incident up front with one person of our group (who wouldn't turn his hat around) and they kicked him out. We had no idea that incident took place and the General Manager stormed back to our table and told us to all leave. We were treated so horribly and were being screamed at by the GM (can you say embarrasing?!) and we had no clue what was even going on. We had to leave that second with our drink cups full, food still on our plate AND still had to pay our bills with the 18% gratuity conveniently tacked on the check. 

I have filed a complaint with the owner and will never step foot in there again. If you are brave enough to give it a shot then I can only hope your experience is better than mine. Such a disappointment...
This is always a great place to pop in for Happy Hour. The Masas de Puerco and Mojitos are excellent, and the staff always treat us like friends that they are happy to see.

We just returned to Havana Grill after not eating there for several months. The food was delicious. The sangria was one of the best I've had in town. They have live entertainment Friday through Sunday, what a fabulous singer and guitar player he is. All his songs were wonderful. The fans were on, the sangria flowing  and we almost felt like we were on one of the islands. Service was superb.  We felt the pricing was very fair for the quality of food we were served. Looking forward to trying them out for lunch.
Lunch is nice and quiet around Havana Grill with plenty of seating and an attentive staff.  I absolutely LOVE the Ropa Vieja here with some fried plantains on the side.  Scrumptious!

Knowing this was a Cuban-Mex fusion, I did not have high hopes for this restaurant.  I came here not reading any reviews, because this was the chosen dinner spot and that's that.  =)

I ordered the lechon asado, knowing well I would only return if this dish was done right.  The plate came out with a side of salad, black beans, a mound of white rice shaped by the bowl and finally the decent amount of pork served on another bowl.  Why a bunch of bowl and not just served on the plate?  I don't know.  The marinated onions that are sour,  pairs so well with the semi-shredded pork dish.  Tender meat, great flavors, decent portion and I'm sold.

We had an order of yuca, reminds me of my childhood.  We used to make a hot dessert with tapioca and cubed yuca, which made this dessert a wonderful winter treat.  This yuca is cooked down so the starchy root is perfect with a fork, marinated over olive oil, a drizzle of cheese and a whole load of marinated thin sliced onions rings.  Drool!!!  This was an excellent side dish, if you love yuca.

The ropa vieja (shredded beef) was on point and my husband really enjoyed his dish too.  He opted for moros (mixed black bean and rice) and devoured the dish because it was delicious. 

The plantains were buttery sweet, unfortunately doesn't come with the dish, but as a side order.  

The verdict- Comparing this to Cuban restaurants to the ones in California, I would say they are on par.  Also, if you're into Latin night, they have an area for live music, possibly dancing on one of the weeknights.
A great place to grab some tasty Cuban food. Lunch portions are generous. It did have a funny smell when we entered, but it may have just been the day. Not sure.

Went here with two dinner companions the other night - 5/10/13.  It was late, so I had one of the appetizer platters for my dinner.  It consisted of one tamale, one papa rellena, 2 croquetas, and one mini-Cuban sandwich.  The appetizers were okay, but nothing impressive, One of my companions had a beef entree and the other a chicken entree - I sampled both and both were quite tasty. My difficulty came about with the wine.  I asked for a glass of Pinot Grigio, priced at $7 on the wine menu. First, I got a Pinot Noir, and sent that back.  I had a second glass of the same.  When the check came, each glass was priced at $11 - $4 more for each glass!  After a conversation with the waitress, she went off and talked to someone, and refunded us $6 on the bill.  What happened to the other $2?  It got taken out of her tip - if they can't do math better than that, too bad.  Very disappointing in how it was handled.  Then they were setting up for dancing later - there were many still dining, but that didn't stop the staff from noisily moving tables, chairs, rearranging furniture repeatedly, and otherwise giving the indication that dining (apparently) was no longer their priority.  Really?

One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!! I can't believe all of the bad reviews I'm seeing about this place. I grew up with friends of all ethnicities and Cuban being one, so I must say I've had a lot of Cuban food to know the real deal and this place is definitely the real deal!! The employees are all super friendly, and the service is great! I've been here maybe 20 times and I've never had a bad experience.

The food is absolutely delicious. I've had many different things on the menu and every dish I've ordered, I LOVED!! My personal favorite items on the menu are : Moros y christianos, yuca al mojo con chicharrones, mariquitas, pan con bistec, bistec de palomilla, pollo a la plancha and the arroz con pollo. 

There were some complaints about the prices and the dishes being too small?... I definitely disagree with that. I've never gotten a meal from there that didn't leave me anything but OVERLY FULL!!! Side dishes range from $3 to $6. Sandwiches are $11-$13. Main entrees $14- $18. I think the prices are reasonable for the amount of food and the quality of food and the service that you get. 

I love havana grill!!!

First time here 4/30 for a friends birthday. They were crowded but it was a nice blended crowd, families, all ages and races. I really liked the environment and ambiance of this place. There was Music and dancing, I think that its only on weekends. It took a long time to get service, and I was okay with it at first because it was a full night. When I finally did get a menu, it was after about 15 -20 minutes. An additional 15-20 minutes to get her to stop to take our order. I had stop her to ask her are you taking orders because she never asked and continued to walk past. It took about 35 minutes to get the food in the time she didn't come back to ask if we wanted new drinks. Which were ordered when we first walked in. When we got the food, one of the meals was wrong, it mentioned it to the server that brought the food out but the person told him it was fine since she didn't want to wait another 30 minutes to eat. After we ate, we finally flagged her down for new drinks. She was going to keep walking. When she brought the bill and when we chose not to pay the SUGGESTED tip. However she WAS tipped. She came back to ask why she was not tipped the amount suggested that she had circled on the bill. I was really shocked.. I told her why and she said she understood and but why didn't we tell her ?? It took you 30+ Minutes to even take our order !!  It was very audacious of her to approach me that way. Her name was Eunice. Other than that .. I really like the place and intend to return, maybe it was a bad night for her.

I use to love this place and I was craving for Lechon Asado so we drove a good 20 minutes to have lunch.
I ordered the lunch special Lechon asado  with rice and black beans and sweet plantain. My guest ordered Fried chicken which we ask if it is white meat and the waitress said "yes". We also asked if it comes with plantain and she said "no but I'll ask the kitchen to throw in a few pieces. 

The food came rather quick which is impressive but that's about it. My asado taste a little stale and the plantain is over riped that it should not be served anymore. My friends chicken came with a leg and thigh and not white meat. The over riped plantain she got was later on charged as a side for $5 extra. I guess thats what she meant when she said I'll put a few pieces. Never mentioned we will be charged. 

A very disappointing lunch altogether. Another place that deteriorate in service and taste instead of maintaining their quality. I will not come back anymore.

We decided to give this place a try because we are big fans of Florida cafe in Downtown Las Vegas and we were not disappointed. We also found out that both places have the same owner. Their mojitos are a must! So refreshing and tasty. We ordered chicken fajitas. The portion was pretty big! I am not a big fan of Cuban/Mexican cuisine but I really loved this place. I will come back with great pleasure.

I like to find the Cuban places and one of my favorite sandwiches, the Cuban! The mini  Cuban on the menu is wonderful, Add a bit more sauce and it would be perfect for me. The Bread appetizer was warm and perfect. The Chicken soup is chunky enough  and flavorful. With the lemon squeeze (I would have preferred lime) it is quite enhanced. All in all - I am coming back to test a few more items and enjoy the lovely ambiance and snappy service. Live Music on Friday and Saturday and I want to be part of that, but that will be another trip.
